full_summary:
Senior (Level 3) Life Cycle Management Specialist (LCMS) for Ships' Freshwater Production, Treatment and Distribution Systems

# Request for Proposal

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking to engage a qualified Service Provider to provide one (1) Senior (Level 3) Life Cycle Management Specialist (LCMS) for Ships' Freshwater Production, Treatment and Distribution Systems. 

## Requirement Overview

The requirement is to support the Directorate of Maritime Equipment Program Management Major Surface Combatant, updating, maintaining and managing His Majesty's Canadian (HMC) Ships' and Submarines' Freshwater production, Treatment and Distribution Systems for all Class vessels. The Service Provider will be responsible for providing Project Management, Technical Investigation and Engineering Support.

## Services Required

The Contract will require a total of 230 days of effort from the resource. The proposed period of contract will be for a fixed duration from the date of Contract to December 3rd, 2026, inclusive, followed by up to two (2) additional one (1) year option periods.

## Applicable Trade Agreements

The following trade agreements are applicable to this procurement:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement

## Assessment Criteria

The proposed service provider will be assessed on the basis of the Lowest Price.

## Security Clearance

The requirement is classified SECRET. The Service Provider must have a minimum security level of SECRET to perform this contract.

## Evaluation Process

The evaluation process will be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the Rules for the Evaluation of Bids (REB), as amended from time to time. 

## Contact Information

The contracting authority for this procurement is Mr. Amira Saleh, D Mar P 3-4-5-2. The contact email is DMarP3BidSubmission-DOMar3Soumissiondesoffres@forces.gc.ca. The phone number is (343) 551-7569.
